title: Can license plate data be used against women seeking an abortion?
description: Illinois Secretary of State Alexi Giannoulias is backing what he says is a first-in-the-nation bill to outlaw sharing or selling license plate data for women seeking abortions. He fears this data could be weaponized as some states try to criminalize helping someone get an abortion. NBC News’ Anne Thompson explains more.

title: The conspiracy candidate: What RFK Jr.’s anti-vaccine crusade could look like in the White House
description: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. is a conspiracy theorist running for president as a Democrat. Experts fear his anti-vaccine activism threatens public health in America.

title: With festivals and reflection, America marks Juneteenth
description: Americans from coast to coast celebrated Juneteenth this weekend, taking to the streets to commemorate the end of slavery after the Civil War.

title: YouTube removes video of Robert F. Kennedy Jr. and Jordan Peterson for vaccine misinformation
description: YouTube has removed a video of Robert F. Kennedy Jr. speaking with podcast host Jordan Peterson for spreading what the company said was vaccine misinformation.

title: House GOP moves to ban public access to military service records
description: House Republicans are attempting to end the  release of the service records of current and former military members after the Pentagon erroneously released the personal information of several GOP politicians.

title: Tourist submarine visiting Titanic wreck goes missing, prompting Coast Guard search
description: The Coast Guard launched a search for a missing tourist submarine that disappeared Sunday after it went to explore the wreck of the Titanic but didn't return.

title: Death toll from Southern storms rises to 6 after a likely tornado, with more extreme weather ahead
description: One person is dead after a suspected tornado tore through a Mississippi town overnight. Residents across the South are bracing for more severe weather on Monday.

title: Blinken says spy balloon 'chapter should be closed' after China talks
description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken told NBC News on Monday that his trip to Beijing marked an “important start” in stabilizing U.S. ties with China and that the countries should move on from the spy balloon incident that postponed his earlier visit.

title: Judge bars Trump from disclosing — or keeping — evidence in documents case
description: A judge issued a protective order Monday barring Donald Trump from disclosing evidence set to be turned over to him by the government in the classified documents case.

title: How one city's apology to Black and Latino residents sparked a backlash
description: Hayward, Calif., apologized for its role in destroying a Black and Latino community in the 1960s. Some locals say the apology has done more harm than good.

title: Air Force sergeant found dead after going missing during training exercise in Arizona
description: A 33-year-old airman based in Arizona was found dead at Roosevelt Lake over the weekend, officials said, days after he was reported missing during a training exercise.

title: Blinken meets Xi in bid to ease China tensions
description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken is set to meet with Chinese President Xi Jinping in Beijing on Monday on a visit aimed at easing tensions.

title: At least 15 shot, 4 dead, in shootings across the U.S. on the last Sunday of spring
description: Shootings erupted across the nation, in both rural and urban locations, on the last Sunday of meteorological spring, according to reports from authorities.

title: 'The Flash' disappoints with a $55 million debut
description: “The Flash,” a superhero adventure starring Ezra Miller, emerged victorious over Pixar’s “Elemental” in a battle of box office lightweights.

title: Retiring civil rights leader says Juneteenth shouldn't be jubilant
description: Civil rights leader  Rev. William J. Barber II delivered his last sermon as pastor of his North Carolina church Sunday, saying Juneteenth should be somber.
